summary: The code seems to question the necessity of reading a libinput record, which may contain information like tty/pid/network-port/timestamp. It suggests that this data is not useful unless there's a way to replay the entire scenario.

details.comment: The code seems to question the necessity of reading a libinput record, which may contain information like tty/pid/network-port/timestamp. It suggests that this data is not useful unless there's a way to replay the entire scenario.
details.content:
the libinput record is more readable but do we have to read this?
i mean this is not useful at all till you can somehow replay this whole scenario.
tty/pid/network-port/timestamp all these concepts.
